seo.title: Kling 2.5 Turbo – AI Text-to-Video & Image-to-Video (1080p, 5–10s, Silent)
seo.description: Cinematic, silent 1080p clips in 5–10 seconds from text or a single image. Pro Text / Pro Image / Standard tiers, 16:9/9:16/1:1, price-before-render in MaxVideoAI.

overview: Kling 2.5 Turbo in MaxVideoAI: cinematic, silent 1080p clips from text or one image, 5–10 seconds, 16:9/9:16/1:1. Choose Pro Text, Pro Image or Standard per render to balance quality and cost.

hero.title: Kling 2.5 Turbo – AI Text-to-Video & Image-to-Video in MaxVideoAI (1080p, 5–10s)
hero.intro: Cinematic, silent clips with standout motion and physics — built for camera-forward shots.
hero.badge: 1080p · 5–10s · Text or Image input · Silent output

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video (Pro Text); Image → Video (Pro Image / Standard) with one still

technicalOverview.label: Controls
technicalOverview.body: Negative prompt; CFG scale (~0.5–0.7 sweet spot); tier selector (Pro Text / Pro Image / Standard)

technicalOverview.label: Pricing
technicalOverview.body: Shown per 5 seconds in-app; example: Pro 5s ≈ $0.35, 10s ≈ $0.70; Standard cheaper (≈$0.21 / $0.42)

promptStructure.title: Text-to-Video with Kling 2.5 Turbo
promptStructure.quote: 10 second [aspect ratio] cinematic shot of [subject] in [environment]. Camera [movement] while [main action] plays out, realistic motion and detailed lighting. Style: [gritty / glossy / cinematic]. No text, no logos, no extra characters.
promptStructure.description: Write prompts like a short DoP note: subject/framing, environment, camera move, pacing, lighting/look, plus a clear negative prompt.
steps: Camera move (dolly, tracking, handheld sway, orbit, etc.)
Lighting & look (gritty, glossy, neon, commercial, etc.)
Negative prompt to block text/logos/extra characters

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Keep prompts to 1–2 tight sentences; very long prompts can wander
Use a strong negative prompt: “no text, no logos, no extra people”
Pro Text for highest fidelity; Pro Image for portrait/product from a still; Standard for cheaper loops
Stick to one scene; stitch multiple clips for longer stories
Add your own audio in the edit or pair with Wan/Sora/Veo clips

prompts.title: Alley action (10s, 16:9)
prompts.prompt: 10s 16:9 handheld tracking shot of a man sprinting through a narrow city alley at night. Camera runs behind and to the side, breathing with footsteps as neon signs and wet cobblestones streak past. High contrast, reflections, realistic motion blur, film grain. No text, no logos, no police cars, no explosions.

prompts.title: Founder portrait drift (5s, 9:16)
prompts.prompt: 5s vertical 9:16 shot of a founder standing by a window at golden hour. Slow handheld drift from chest-up to closer on the face, shallow depth of field, city lights softly blurred. Realistic skin, crisp shirt details, gentle flares. No text, no logos, no extra people.

faqs.a: No. It is video-only and produces silent 1080p clips; add sound in your editor or pair with audio-capable engines.

faqs.q: What durations and formats are supported?
faqs.a: 5 or 10 seconds in 16:9, 9:16 or 1:1 for both text and image runs.

faqs.q: Can I upload more than one reference image?
faqs.a: No. One image per render. Combine references into one board if needed and describe the camera path clearly.
Per 5s/10s shown in-app. Pro tiers ~ $0.35 / $0.70; Standard image cheaper. Confirm live price in the chip before rendering.

faqs.q: When should I use another engine?
faqs.a: Use Sora/Veo/Wan for native audio or multi-beat stories; use Pika for stylized animation or pixel looks.

custom.heroDesc1: Generate cinematic, silent 1080p clips from text or a single still. Choose Pro Text, Pro Image or Standard per render to balance fidelity and cost.
custom.heroDesc2: Pick 5 or 10 seconds, 16:9/9:16/1:1, upload one image or write a focused prompt, and get crisp footage ready for editors and social teams.
custom.heroSupportLine: Best for product hero beats, dynamic action moments, and portrait/selfie animation from a single still.
heroHighlights: Motion + physics that feel intentional||Strong inertia and believable movement in short beats.
Camera-first results||Clear framing and one-move shots read like real cinematography.
Silent by design||Easy to score in post and match your brand audio.
Clean-up controls||Negative prompts help avoid text, logos, and extra characters.
Quick quality switching||Move between tiers without rewriting your whole prompt.
custom.whatTitle: What Kling 2.5 Turbo Actually Is in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Kling 2.5 Turbo is a high-performance short-form video model for cinematic motion, strong prompt adherence and consistent style.
custom.whatIntro2: In MaxVideoAI it is a single, multi-tier engine you can switch per render.
whatFlowSteps: 2. Pick Text → Video (Pro Text) or Image → Video (Pro Image / Standard).
4. Choose Pro vs Standard for quality vs budget.
5. Paste a cinematic, camera-focused prompt and optional negative prompt.
6. Check exact price before you render.
7. Compare against Sora, Veo, Wan, MiniMax in the same workspace.
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – Kling 2.5 Turbo in MaxVideoAI (1080p, 5–10s)
custom.specNote: This describes Kling 2.5 Turbo as used in MaxVideoAI.

specSections.title: Motion & physics
specSections.intro: Strong on kinetic motion and believable physics. Best for camera-forward action beats.
items: Keep the subject centered for readability.
Great for action beats and product spins.

specSections.title: Silent finishing
specSections.intro: Outputs are silent by design, making post-sound easy. A good fit for B-roll loops and cutaways.
items: Use negative prompts to avoid text/logos.

custom.specValueProp: Kling 2.5 Turbo is a silent 1080p engine for cinematic short beats with strong motion and physics.
custom.galleryIntro: Actual runs from the current Kling route in MaxVideoAI.
custom.promptIntro: Write like a DoP: subject/framing, environment, camera, pacing, look, and negatives.
custom.promptSkeleton: 10 second [aspect ratio] cinematic shot of [subject] in [environment]. Camera [movement] while [main action] plays out. Lighting [style], [grade] look. No text, no logos, no extra characters.
custom.promptSkeletonNote: Keep it concise; avoid overlong briefs to prevent wandering cameras.
custom.imageIntro: Animate one still via Pro Image or Standard tiers.
imageFlow: Upload a portrait, product shot or keyframe (PNG/JPG/WEBP).
Pick Pro Image for max fidelity or Standard for cheaper loops.
Set duration, aspect ratio and 1080p output.
Describe motion (camera/subject) and add a negative prompt to prevent overlays.
imageWhy: Founder portraits to subtle walk-and-talk shots
Product hero stills with parallax & camera drift
Cinematic loops from 3D renders or concept frames
custom.multishotIntro1: Kling excels at focused 5 or 10 second beats.
custom.multishotIntro2: Treat 5s as one gesture; 10s as 2–3 mini beats with a coherent camera path.
multishotTips: One scene, one style; stitch clips for longer edits
Use Beats 1/2/3 to plan a 10s arc (establish, tension, hero frame)
Use Recreate-from-gallery to see pacing patterns
strengths: Top-tier cinematic motion and realism in short clips
Great for action, handheld, tracking, and “shot on phone” looks
boundaries: 5 or 10 seconds max; stitch for longer stories
No native audio; add sound in post or pair with audio engines
Very verbose prompts can wander; keep it tight
Tiny on-screen text/UI is unreliable—overlay critical copy
custom.tipsFooter: Respect these constraints and Kling becomes a predictable 1080p workhorse.
safetyRules: No explicit sexual content or sexualized minors
Avoid hateful, harassing or extremist content
Don’t use real likeness without consent; avoid IP infringement
Provider and MaxVideoAI moderation may block/adjust content
safetyInterpretation: Use Kling for brand-safe, legal, ethical content
custom.safetyNote: Treat Kling as a professional, compliant tool.
custom.comparisonTitle: Kling vs Sora / Veo / Wan / Pika – Quick Overview
comparisonPoints: Kling 2.5 Turbo: 1080p, silent, cinematic; great for action and hero shots
Sora 2 / Sora 2 Pro: 720p / high-res (up to 1792×1024) with audio for physics-heavy mini-films
Veo 3.1: controllable framing presets, audio on/off, 4–8 s beats
Wan 2.5: 5–10 s with native or uploaded audio for music/VO sync
Pika 2.2: stylized, silent animation for loops and playful visuals

faqs.a: No. It is video-only and silent; add sound in your editor or via audio-capable engines.

faqs.q: What durations and formats are supported?
faqs.a: 5 or 10 seconds; 16:9, 9:16, 1:1 for text and image runs.
One image per render. Merge references into a single board if needed.
Per 5s/10s shown in-app. Pro ~ $0.35/$0.70; Standard cheaper. Use the price chip before rendering.

faqs.q: When should I choose another engine?
faqs.a: Use Sora/Veo/Wan for native audio; Pika for stylized/pixel looks; Sora/Veo for multi-beat audio stories.

custom.relatedSubtitle: Compare pricing, latency, and outputs across the MaxVideoAI catalog.
custom.finalPara1: Kling 2.5 Turbo in MaxVideoAI is your 1080p, silent, cinematic engine for short, punchy beats.
custom.finalPara2: Use it when camera work and motion carry the story, then layer audio in post or pair with audio engines.
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Kling 2.5 Turbo Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Kling Turbo performs best with short, concrete prompts and clear motion cues.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI — your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, style, and sound.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Describe the subject, composition, and lighting clearly.
Use visual anchors (specific nouns > vague adjectives).
Iterate: change one thing at a time.
custom.tipsIntro: Kling Turbo is most predictable when you keep the shot simple, readable, and physical.
promptingEngineWhy: Optimized for speed — keep prompts short and focused.
Avoid too many beats in one clip.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + 1 clear action or pose.]

Setting:
[Where + time of day + 2–3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing: [wide / medium / close-up]
- Angle: [eye-level / low / high]
- Lens feel: [e.g., 35mm natural, shallow DOF]

Lighting + palette:
[Key light + 2–3 palette anchors]

Style constraints:
No logos. No readable text. Clean background.

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Project / intent:
[One-line goal for the still.]

Subject:
[Who/what + wardrobe/materials + 2–3 distinctive traits.]

Location / set:
[Where + time of day + weather. Add 3 visual anchors.]

Composition:
- Framing + angle
- Lens feel + depth of field
- Look: [clean digital / subtle film grain / soft bloom]

Lighting & grade:
- Key light
- Contrast
- Palette anchors (3–5)

Constraints:
No logos. No readable text. No overlays.
